revision_history.draft:
The pause between heartbeats is a line  
in the geometry of a paused conversation.  

A breath held mid-exhalation,  
a taut thread of air—  
the texture of what trembles  
before the next sound.  

The room’s architecture hums  
with the weight of what isn’t said.  

Silence is the space between  
the word and its meaning,  
a hollow where the unspoken  
lives,  
not in absence,  
but in the architecture  
of the gap.

revision_history.draft:
The pause between heartbeats is a line  
etched in the geometry of a paused conversation.  

A breath held mid-exhalation,  
a taut thread of air—  
the texture of what trembles  
in the hush before the next sound.  

The room’s architecture hums  
with the weight of unsaid words.  

Silence is the space between  
the word and its meaning,  
a hollow where the unspoken  
dwells—  
not in absence,  
but in the architecture  
of the gap.

final_poem:
The pause between heartbeats is a line  
carved in the geometry of a paused conversation.  

A breath held mid-exhalation—  
a taut thread of air,  
the texture of a trembling thread  
in the hush before the next sound.  

The room’s architecture hums  
with the weight of unsaid words.  

Silence is the space between  
the word and its meaning,  
a cavity where the unspoken  
dwells—not in absence,  
but in the scaffolding  
of the gap.
